source.body: Note: Some tissues or section size may need longer baking time. Recommended to bake at least 1 hour for brain tissue or TMA. This can be extended to 16 h (overnight).

source.name: Thermo ScientificTM Lab VisionTM PT Module

source.title: Slide baking and PT module preparation

source.description:
PT Module Preheat
Press RUN on digital screen and check for PREHEAT 75 on display

Linear Stainer
Pour out reagent containers and fill with fresh reagents:
Xylene 3x, 100% Ethanol 2x, 95% Ethanol 2x, 80% Ethanol 1x, 70% Ethanol 1x, ddH2O 2x, exit stainless steel tank = ddH2O

source.body: IMPORTANT: Use fresh xylene for every deparaffination

source.description:
Insert slides into slide carriers
Place the slide carrier into first xylene container

Press on Menu
Check for Processing time = 30 sec, Lift bar = 976, Number of dips = 3
Set Start position corresponding to the first slide carrier position
Exemple: If the first slide carrier is at position 4, use Plus (+) or Minus (-) button to increase or decrease to get Start at: 04
Then press enter
Synchronize when the PT module temperature has reached 75˚C then Press Run on the Linear Stainer
Allow the rehydration process and wait until the slides reached the stainless steel tank and stop
Bring the stainless steel tank with the slides close to the PT module
Press run again and check for first WARMUP then HEAT on display

Allow to run for 40 min at
and then cool down for approximately 50 min and reach
When the alarm sounds Stop the PT module
Take out the slides and let cool down at room temperature for at least
Quenching Horseradish Peroxidase (HRP)
Prepare two Coplin jars filled with 1x PBS wash buffer
Open the PT Module and insert the slides in the Target retrieval solution container

Make a 1:10 dilution of 30% Hydrogen peroxide H2O2

Add secondary

Place sample in a humidity chamber, transfer to
, and incubate
than go to step 32

Add 1 drop of chromogenic solution (DAB) in
dilution buffer (ImmPACT DAB Peroxidase (HRP) Substrate, SK-4105, Vector lab)

Equilibrate at
the chromogenic substrate and revealing buffer
Take the slide from 1x PBS wash buffer
Place the slide on a absorbant meterial (preferably white)
At 10 s count up, add rapidly the solution in excess over tissue section; starting with the lowest titer
Start a count up timer and take immediatly 1mL DAB diluted solution with 1 mL pipette
Stop at 50 s count up by tapping the side of the slide to remove DAB and putting the slide back in the wash buffer

source.body:
DAB chromogenic reaction is revealed by a brown coloration in positive areas.
Optimal revelation time ranges between 30s to 1 min.
Rapid brown apperance (<15s) after adding the DAB indicates an over titration of the primary antibody.
Light brown or no coloration >1 min reveals is undertitered primary antibody or negative result.
Revealling time should be set constant at 40s but can be extented up to 1 min max.
Optimal titer at constant development time ensure consistency when large number of slides are processed.

source.description:
Optional
Chromogenic development can be performed directly under a microscope.
This should be done at low magnification using a 5 x or a 10x objective. This way, it helps to cover a large field of view where positive areas can be observed.
At higher magnification (e.g. 40x), it is likely that the DAB solution will contaminate the objective and cause a permanent stain if not cleaned immediately with ROR (Residual Oil Remover, EMS, 74319-35) and lens paper.
This procedure can be used for single preliminary test but is not recommended for large scale.
Importantly, make sure to clean the objectives and stage after use. Otherwise, DAB residues will stain permanently the surface in contact and increase deterioration of the microscope parts in the long term.
Prepare a 1L beaker filled with tap water in a sink
Set staining area by protecting counter top with an absorbant

Add Hematoxylin to cover all tissue sections (Hematoxylin Solution, Harris Modified, Sigma-Aldrich, HHS16-500ML)
After 10s stop by dipping and rinsing in the tap water beaker
Reveal one slide at the time
Start a count up timer
Add 1x Scott's tap water for 10s, until blue color is revealed
Put in 70% ethanol

source.title: Deshydration and VectaMount Permanent Mounting Medium

source.description:
Prepare the linear stainer
Place the reagents in the following order:
70% Ethanol 1x, 80% Ethanol 1x, 95% Ethanol 2x, 100% Ethanol 2x, exit stainless steel tank = empty

Prepare the linear stainer
Place the reagents in the following order:
70% Ethanol 1x, 80% Ethanol 1x, 95% Ethanol 2x, 100% Ethanol 2x, Xylene 3x, exit stainless steel tank = empty
Let air dry for at least
Add 2 drops of mounting media on tissue area by squeezing down the bottle gently for Cytoseal 60 or ~70 µL of ACRYTOL from a small aliquot put in a 50 mL tube

source.body: Work under a fume hood. The mounting media contains toluene as solvent.

source.title: Deshydration and VectaMount Permanent Mounting Medium

source.description: Let air dry for at least
Place a glass coverslip no. 1.5 (Thermo Scientific, Gold Seal, coverslips, #1.5, Fisher Scientific, 12-518-108A)

source.description:
Bake at
for
prior long term storage

Let dry
under fume prior long term storage
Dip 3x the slide quickly in xylene prior mounting
Excess of mounting media can be removed by dipping back the slide in xylene and wiping excess along the slide edges

description: This is standard immunohistochemistry (IHC) procedure recommended in the Bendall and Angelo lab.
